messages.content:
Hi, I have a strange issue with transactions, that include sending tokens:
```
const payerUpdate = AccountUpdate.create(user);
payerUpdate.send({ to: this.address, amount: UInt64.from(receiveAmount) });
payerUpdate.requireSignature();
...
this.send({ to: user, amount: UInt64.from(sendAmount) });
```

It works fine, when I interact with contract from script, but when I send that transaction from UI, during transaction creation, I get an error:

```
VM9:2208 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Type "number" cannot be used with function "toFields"
    at raise_error (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5238906)
    at check_type$1 (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5267395)
    at to_field_elts_magic (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5267503)
    at caml_call1 (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:6:747)
    at eval (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5263449)
    at caml_call1 (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:6:747)
    at array_iter (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5263072)
    at array_map (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5263410)
    at to_field_elts_magic (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5267541)
    at I (eval at w0 (index.js:1:1), <anonymous>:2208:5267789)
```
It looks like something is not set correctly after `AccountUpdate.create()`, but not  sure exactly.

BTW, everything works fine in UI, if I remove this token sending logic from my method. 

Maybe someone had similar issues and found out how to solve them?

seems like no one had similar issues 🤔  would need to see more code to resolve. If someone differs between UI and script my guess would be that some input is of a different type (just because I can't think of anything else that might be different)
